parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Injustice, unrighteousness, hurt. From adikos; injustice; morally, wrongfulness.
(Aramaic), riches, money, possessions, property. Of Chaldee origin; mammonas, i.e. Avarice.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Friendly; subst: a friend, an associate. Properly, dear, i.e. A friend; actively, fond, i.e. Friendly.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural

str2: In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To fail, die out, come to an end, be defunct. From ek and leipo; to omit, i.e. cease.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A tent, booth, tabernacle, abode, dwelling, mansion, habitation. Apparently akin to skeuos and skia; a tent or cloth hut.
